rows.name: Zinc
rows.example_where_to_find: Pumpkin seeds and lablab are examples of zinc rich foods.
rows.properties: Supports growth and the immune system
rows.deficiency: Zinc deficiency leads to poor immunity and diseases.
rows.symptoms_of_deficiency: Wounds that don't heal quickly, open sores on the skin, frequent colds, frequent diarrhea, loss of appetite, brain fog, reduced taste and smell, and balding too soon in adults.

rows.name: Iron
rows.example_where_to_find:
Lablab, amaranth, and soybean are examples of iron rich foods
Meat - especially liver
Eggs
Dark leafy vegetables
rows.deficiency: Iron deficiency leads to anemia and feeling tired.
rows.symptoms_of_deficiency: General body weakness, pale or yellow skin, shortness of breath, dizziness or lightheadedness, cold hands and feet, headache.

rows.name: Proteins
rows.example_where_to_find: How well/ poorly a protein can perform its metabolic function in the body is defined by the protein quality in a substance. Some of the proteins with high quality are from animal sources like eggs, milk, meat, fish and poultry. Other examples like Soybean, groundnut, and buckweat are examples of protein rich foods.
rows.properties: Important for body repair and making new cells
rows.deficiency: Lack of protein leads to kwashiorkor and marasmus.
rows.symptoms_of_deficiency: Stunted growth in children, loss of appetite, hair loss, fatigue.

rows.name: Calcium
rows.example_where_to_find: Milk, dark green leafy vegetables and soybeans are rich in calcium.
rows.deficiency: Lack of calcium causes bones to become brittle and can lead to brain damage.
rows.symptoms_of_deficiency: Numbness, tingling sensations, muscle cramps, poor appetite.

rows.name: Vitamin A
rows.example_where_to_find: Vitamin A can be found in liver, fish, spinach.eggs, carrots and in dairy products such as milk and yoghurt.
rows.properties: Plays a role in maintaining vision, body growth, immunity and reproductive health.
rows.deficiency: Lack of vitamin A can lead to blindness, increased skin infections, pregnacy complications.
rows.symptoms_of_deficiency: night blindness, skin irritation, staunted growth and bitot spots in the eyes.

rows.name: Vitamin C
rows.example_where_to_find: It's mainy in present in fruits and vegetables like oranges and also in potatoes.
rows.properties: It helps in the development and repair of body tissues.
rows.deficiency: Deficiency in Vitamin C can cause scurvy.
rows.symptoms_of_deficiency: Hair loss, delay in the healing of skin wounds, swelling or bleeding gums.
